description: Learn how to navigate power dynamics in Agile transformations with insights from  Laurens Bonnema. Understand the political landscape of corporate environments.  🎥 Dive into the world of organisational power dynamics with Laurens Bonnema as we explore the intersection of Agile transformations and political economy. From understanding power struggles to practising political skills, this video offers a deep dive into the realities of corporate environments. Whether you're a Scrum Master, Product Owner, or Agile Coach, these insights will help you navigate and influence the political landscape in your organisation. 🌟  00:00:06 Introduction to Hans Morgenthau’s Realist Theory 00:00:39 Introduction of Guest Laurens Bonnema 00:01:28 Political Economy in Organisations 00:03:59 Realism Tempered with Idealism 00:07:47 Power Dynamics in Corporate Environments 00:11:20 Challenges of Political Engagement in Organisations 00:16:30 Training and Practising Political Skills 00:21:45 Agile Transformations and Power Redistribution 00:27:57 Managing Organisational Change 00:33:33 Special Forces vs. Regular Teams 00:38:00 Communicating and Building Political Capital 00:43:45 Books and Resources on Power Dynamics 00:48:00 Final Thoughts and Tips
html_description:
Learn how to navigate power dynamics in Agile transformations with insights from
Laurens Bonnema. Understand the political landscape of corporate environments.
🎥 Dive into the world of organisational power dynamics with Laurens Bonnema as we explore the intersection of Agile transformations and political economy. From understanding power struggles to practising political skills, this video offers a deep dive into the realities of corporate environments. Whether you're a Scrum Master, Product Owner, or Agile Coach, these insights will help you navigate and influence the political landscape in your organisation. 🌟

description: 🚀 *Dive deep into Agile with Martin & Simon with this months guest Oscar!* Learn how these experts tackle real-world challenges in agile environments.  Unlocking Agility with a Philosophy of Flexibility and Continuous Improvement - Discover how embracing a philosophy of flexibility transforms teams and projects. Dive into a journey of continuous improvement, collaboration, and change.  Hey there! 🌟 If you're on a quest to unlock the full potential of your team and projects, you're in the right place. In this video, we share our personal reflections on embracing a philosophy of flexibility and the importance of continuous improvement. It's a deep dive into how these principles can revolutionize the way we work, collaborate, and respond to change. 🚀 Let's explore together how to create environments that foster innovation, satisfaction, and, most importantly, meaningful progress. So, grab a cup of coffee ☕, get comfortable, and let's get philosophical about agility!
html_description:
🚀 *Dive deep into Agile with Martin & Simon with this months guest Oscar!* Learn how these experts tackle real-world challenges in agile environments.

Hey there! 🌟 If you're on a quest to unlock the full potential of your team and projects, you're in the right place. In this video, we share our personal reflections on embracing a philosophy of flexibility and the importance of continuous improvement. It's a deep dive into how these principles can revolutionize the way we work, collaborate, and respond to change. 🚀 Let's explore together how to create environments that foster innovation, satisfaction, and, most importantly, meaningful progress. So, grab a cup of coffee ☕, get comfortable, and let's get philosophical about agility!
name: Mindset Versus Philosophy

description: Dive into the world of agile facilitation with Charles-Louis de Maere, uncovering effective strategies for training, visual aids, and organizational change. Perfect for Agile coaches and enthusiasts seeking practical insights. 🌟 In this engaging discussion, Martin and Simon delve into the art of Agile facilitation with Charles-Louis de Maere, a master of visual facilitation. Explore the nuances of training delivery, the impact of visual aids, and the importance of adaptability in facilitation. 🚀 From discussing the difference between training and workshops to revealing the power of visual storytelling in learning, this podcast is a treasure trove of insights for Agile practitioners. 📈 Key Topics:  00:00:00 Introduction to Agile Facilitation 00:06:38 Agile Training and Organizational Change 00:12:46 Dynamics of Facilitation and Learning 00:24:07 Visual Facilitation Techniques 00:36:04 Adapting Facilitation to Contexts

description: Unlock the secrets of ethical agility! Martin Hinshelwood and Simon Reindl dive deep into the world of agile ethics, personal values, and the implications of our actions in today's fast-paced professional landscape. From civilisations' first steps to the challenges of modern organisations, join the journey of reflection and discovery. 🌍🔍💼

Martin Hinshelwood and Simon Reindl dive deep into the world of agile ethics, personal values, and the implications of our actions in today's fast-paced professional landscape. From civilisations' first steps to the challenges of modern organisations, join the journey of reflection and discovery. 🌍🔍💼
name: Ethics in Agile

description: In this month's podcast, Simon Reindl and Martin Hinshelwood explore the importance of transparency, specifically relating to the words we use and the context within which we use those words. Precision matters. Accuracy matters. Saying what you mean and meaning what you say matters. Listen to this podcast for some great insights into why language matters in the #agile world.  About the hosts of Agile Actually  Simon Reindl is the chief #agilecoach, #agileconsultant and #professionalscrumtrainer at Advanced Product Delivery. In addition to traditional #agilecoaching and #agileconsulting, Simon is pioneering #leanagileprocurement in Europe and helping organizations to reinvent how they partner with suppliers and subcontractors.  Visit https://www.apd.coach for more information on Simon.  Martin Hinshelwood is the chief #agileconsultant and #professionalscrumtrainer at NKD Agility. In addition to traditional #agilecoaching, #agileconsulting, and #scrumtraining, Martin is an expert in #devops consulting and engineering. If you are looking for help on anything DevOps, #scrum, #agile or #microsoft, Martin Hinshelwood is your go-to-guy.  Visit https://www.nkdagility.com for more information on Martin.

description: In this month's edition of Agile Actually, Martin and Simon explore the rise of remote work and whether working from the office, as we knew it, is dead.   Some interesting insights from two experts who are both Professional Scrum Trainers in addition to agile coaches and agile consultants, and how the rise of remote work has impacted the effectiveness of training, coaching, and consulting. It may surprise you.   About the hosts of Agile Actually   Simon Reindl is the chief #agilecoach, #agileconsultant and #professionalscrumtrainer at Advanced Product Delivery. In addition to traditional #agilecoaching and #agileconsulting, Simon is pioneering #leanagileprocurement in Europe and helping organizations to reinvent how they partner with suppliers and subcontractors.   Visit https://www.apd.coach for more information on Simon.   Martin Hinshelwood is the chief #agileconsultant and #professionalscrumtrainer at NKD Agility. In addition to traditional #agilecoaching, #agileconsulting, and #scrumtraining, Martin is an expert in #devops consulting and engineering. If you are looking for help on anything DevOps, #scrum, #agile or #microsoft, Martin Hinshelwood is your go-to-guy.   Visit https://www.nkdagility.com for more information on Martin.

description: In this month's episode of Agile Actually, we picked up some whispers on the #agile winds about #productmanagement being obsolete. The idea that if you have a strong #productowner in #scrum, there is no need for a #productmanager at all.  To explore this concept, we invited Ralph Jocham - a #productmanager and #productowner expert - to talk about the differences between product ownership and product management and whether these whispers held any truth.  #productmanager #productmanagement #productdevelopment #productowner #productownership #product   About the hosts of Agile Actually  Simon Reindl is the chief #agilecoach, #agileconsultant and #professionalscrumtrainer at Advanced Product Delivery. In addition to traditional #agilecoaching and #agileconsulting, Simon is pioneering #leanagileprocurement in Europe and helping organizations to reinvent how they partner with suppliers and subcontractors.  Visit https://www.apd.coach for more information on Simon.  Martin Hinshelwood is the chief #agileconsultant and #professionalscrumtrainer at NKD Agility. In addition to traditional #agilecoaching, #agileconsulting, and #scrumtraining, Martin is an expert in #devops consulting and engineering.   If you are looking for help on anything DevOps, #scrum, #agile or #microsoft, Martin Hinshelwood is your go-to-guy. Visit https://www.nkdagility.com for more information on Martin.  Ralph Jocham is the founder of Effective Agile, and is a Certified Professional Scrum Trainer in addition to being an #agilecoach and #agileconsultant. For more information on Ralph and Effective Agile, visit https://www.effectiveagile.com
html_description:
In this month's episode of Agile Actually, we picked up some whispers on the #agile winds about #productmanagement being obsolete. The idea that if you have a strong #productowner in #scrum, there is no need for a #productmanager at all.
To explore this concept, we invited Ralph Jocham - a #productmanager and #productowner expert - to talk about the differences between product ownership and product management and whether these whispers held any truth.

If you are looking for help on anything DevOps, #scrum, #agile or #microsoft, Martin Hinshelwood is your go-to-guy.

name: Product owners are obsolete!

description: In this month's edition of #agileactually, Simon Reindl and Martin Hinshelwood explore the latest trend in #agile for a life coach to present themselves as an #agilecoach to organizations.  In most cases, an #agilecoach or #agilecosultant will have years of experience as an #agilepractitioner, actively working in an #agileteam, followed by certification and practise as an #agilecoach leading multiple #agileteams in multiple applications.  That's why it's controversial that someone with very little #professionalcoaching skills and #agile knowledge would present themselves to organizations as an #agilecoach.  Good? Bad? Or just plain ugly?  Find out in this month's Agile Actually Podcast.  About the hosts of Agile Actually  Simon Reindl is the chief #agilecoach, #agileconsultant and #professionalscrumtrainer at Advanced Product Delivery. In addition to traditional #agilecoaching and #agileconsulting, Simon is pioneering #leanagileprocurement in Europe and helping organizations to reinvent how they partner with suppliers and subcontractors.  Visit https://www.apd.coach for more information on Simon  Martin Hinshelwood is the chief #agileconsultant and #professionalscrumtrainer at NKD Agility. In addition to traditional #agilecoaching, #agileconsulting, and #scrumtraining, Martin is an expert in #devops consulting and engineering. If you are looking for help on anything DevOps, #scrum, #agile or #microsoft, Martin Hinshelwood is your go-to-guy.  Visit https://www.nkdagility.com for more information on Martin.
html_description:

In most cases, an #agilecoach or #agilecosultant will have years of experience as an #agilepractitioner, actively working in an #agileteam, followed by certification and practise as an #agilecoach leading multiple #agileteams in multiple applications.
